snippet: Researchers have discovered the fossil of a 52-million-year-old beetle that lived alongside ants, preying on their eggs and usurping resources.
abstract: Researchers have discovered fossil of 52-million-year-old beetle in India that lived alongside ants, preying on their eggs and usurping resources; fossil is the oldest known example of a kind of social parasitism known as myrmecophily.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have discovered the fossil of a 52-million-year-old beetle that lived alongside ants, preying on their eggs and usurping resources.

headline.main: 52 Million Years Old, and an Ant’s Worst Enemy
headline.print_headline: Fossils: 52 Million Years Old, and an Ant’s Worst Enemy
